    CS-CORE

    CS-CORE is a R package for cell-type-specific co-expression inference from single cell RNA-sequencing data. It provides an implementation for the statistical method CS-CORE proposed in this manuscript.

    Installation

    CS-CORE is available on GitHub. You can install it using

    ## Load devtools for installing R packages from Github
library(devtools)
## Install CS-CORE from Github
install_github("ChangSuBiostats/CS-CORE")

    Vignettes

    The vignette shows an example of using CS-CORE for cell-type-specific co-expression analysis with single cell RNA-sequencing data, which includes inferring co-expressions, extracting co-expressed gene modules and functional enrichment analysis as performed in our manuscript.

    Contact us

    Feel free to contact Chang Su at c.su@yale.edu for questions on applying CS-CORE to your own singe cell data.

    Reference and more

    Cell-type-specific co-expression inference from single cell RNA-sequencing data. Chang Su, Zichun Xu, Xinning Shan, Biao Cai, Hongyu Zhao, Jingfei Zhang. bioRxiv 2022.12.13.520181; doi: https://doi.org/10.1101/2022.12.13.520181

    A Python implementation of CS-CORE is also provided here.
